DOC.brief_title: Titanium-Sapphire Laser Trabeculoplasty Glaucoma : A Randomized Study Comparing Titanium-Sapphire With Argon Laser Trabeculoplasty Open-Angle Glaucoma Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To compare medium-term outcome Titanium-Sapphire laser trabeculoplasty ( TiSLT ) vs. Argon Laser Trabeculoplasty ( ALT ) uncontrolled Open-angle Glaucoma ( OAG ) patient . Methods : Prospective , mask , randomize comparative clinical study . Thirty-seven OAG patient uncontrolled IOP previous filtration surgery ( 22 female 15 male , mean age 68 year ) participate . Eighteen treat TiSLT 19 ALT . All patient underwent comprehensive eye examination include visual acuity , IOP , goniocscopy slit-lamp biomicroscopy visual field examination . Patients examine pre-operatively 1 hour , 1 day , 1 week , 1 , 3 6 month , 1 year 18 month post-operatively . Main outcome measure : Final IOP , delta IOP number anti-glaucoma medication . Results : The 18 patient TiSLT arm average 8.3 ( ±2.7 ) mm Hg 32 % reduction pre-operative IOP ( P < 0.001 ) . The 19 patient ALT arm mean IOP decrease 6.5 ( ±4.3 ) mm Hg ( P < 0.001 ) 25 % IOP reduction . Patients group achieve similar decrease IOP ( P > 0.05 ) . TiSLT patient statistically significant few IOP spike compare ALT group . ( P=0.002 ) . Two patient ( 1 arm ) underwent trabeculectomy consider failure . Mean follow-up time 15 month . Conclusions : TiSLT provide similar efficacy ALT IOP reduction OAG patient , may offer good safety few IOP spike see post-operatively .
